intro: Erinosma verna, commonly known as the spring broom. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Erinosma verna is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
